TopicTitle: A spotlight eminates from a spot that has no light, and can spotlight Kerbin from orbit.

Articles.Content:
Here's an image gallery of what I mean with short explanations.

I'm needing some help tracking down what may or may not be a bug where a spotlight randomly appears to emanate from within a part. The spotlight always points toward the sun, and is powerful enough to make some parts appear to glow, as well as illuminate Kerbin from orbit. When landing, the terrain below the craft can light up in giant tiles that appear to glow, especially at night.

The shuttle is not the only craft that this occurs with. I've noticed it also on my space stations when I'm moving things about.

I'm not sure which mod (if it is a mod) is causing this, and testing the mods often prevents anything from loading if I don't have them all installed.

In searching for a solution, this is the closest I've come. I have no idea how to actually do the solution given here.

Okay. I've tested it without both of those mods.

After uninstalling Surface mounted lights first, the but seems to take it's time to appear, but it does eventually.

After uninstalling Aviation lights second, the but again appears, but while also taking it's time to appear, it's now behaving differently. The spotlight is now pointing 90 degrees to the right if you are oriented with north up and facing the sun. Before, the spotlight was oriented directly at the sun. Also, I haven't don't see the the spotlight emanating from within the ship parts any more, nor do ship parts have the weird glow.

Edit: I just saw the light emanating from within the craft, still. It was much harder to see because of the orientation of the station.

Edited July 15, 2022 by Leafback

Double posting to highlight the significance of this find.

I found something! I was stripping the lights off my mobile utility vehicle and noticed that whenever I accessed the inventory of the nearby hitchhiker container, the spotlight appeared. I figured it was the lights I was stripping and tested it by placing them into a different location. When clicking to access the new inventory locations, the spotlight didn't appear, but still appeared when accessing the Hitchhiker. I noticed that there were 6 4 stacks of struts stored there that didn't have an icon of what they were, but placing them into another location's inventory made the icon appear, but in black.

Once all the icons were visible, I can no longer trigger the spotlight bug to appear. This has to be correlated, but I haven't a clue how or why.
